formattedAddress: 10 Manhattan Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
adrFormatAddress: 10 Manhattan Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA

originalText.text:
Was threatened by maintenance, and when I called customer service she insinuated that he would hit me. I've requested the recording of the call for my personal records and safety, but have been effectively ghosted. Find any other place to live.

(My roommates and the other residents I've met are lovely! It's just the greedy, rude, and insensitive staff.)

originalText.text: It’s decent, but do your due diligence about the room and unit you rent. My co-living unit’s washer/dryer was broken when I got there and it took time for them to fix it. SharedEasy’s staff is pretty communicative and they try to rectify anything that’s an issue. There were some other things that I had more minor issues but they quickly resolved them. I think 4 stars is probably a fair review.

originalText.text:
Efficient and Flexible.

Like all house sharing you cannot expect the same experience as flat was your own but has great flexibility and a regular cleaning service.

I would use again for temporary letting solution.

originalText.text: I stayed for 4 months in different locations and they provided me a very good service. Jose was very friendly and helpful. Always ready to help in whatver way possible.

text.text: I stayed for 4 months in different locations and they provided me a very good service. Jose was very friendly and helpful. Always ready to help in whatver way possible.

originalText.text: I was very disappointed with the customer service and the value of this place. The pictures show the hair and dust that greeted me on my first day. I also paid for a gym membership that I could not use, because there was a dispute between the coliving and the gym. The website tour and the pictures are misleading. The video tour of Lorimer Williamsburg Home does not reflect the reality. Moreover, the common shower did not drain properly, which was very inconvenient.  To make matters worse, they should have given me a towel(I paid for that) on the first day
